description: Unique identifier for this issued-part line on a work order procedure; used as the primary key for the record.
Reference to the work order asset procedure (task/step) this part issue applies to; links the line to its parent activity.
Identifier of the inventory item/part consumed or issued to the work order; links to the item master.
Identifier of the specific component within a bill-of-materials or assembly related to the part line; likely optional; confirm with SME.
Date the part was issued/consumed against the work order for costing and inventory reduction.
Source warehouse/store from which the part was issued.
Bin or sublocation in the warehouse where the part was stored or picked from.
Actual quantity of the part issued to the work order.
Unit cost applied to the issued part at the time of transaction, used to calculate actual material cost.
General ledger account charged for the material issue.
Defines allocation of the charge across multiple GL accounts (percentages or amounts); likely used for cost splitting; confirm with SME.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record for auditing or synchronization.
Free-text notes about the material issue, such as transaction references or remarks.
Additional option flags or attributes for the line; likely system-specific and rarely used; confirm with SME.
Lookup type/category that classifies the associated code (e.g., reason, status, disposition); confirm with SME.
Specific code value classifying this material issue (e.g., reason, status, failure/repair code); links to a lookup.
Timestamp when a user last modified the record, distinct from automated changes; confirm with SME if different from system update.
Identifier of the user who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified by a user.
